heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: There is a storm around.  It's the first significant stormy weather event since 02 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (188°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 4.7°C) and outside temperature (up 3.5°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 8%) and rainfall (up 0.4 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 590 m) and pressure (up 12 mbar).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 994 m) and light levels (up 5856 lux) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 589.8m lower than yesterday, 886.7m lower than the past week, 994.4m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 760m to a maximum of 2130m, averaging 741.7m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1628.4m and 1736.1m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Expect overcast skies with low cloud.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; pleasant, mild temperatures. Also, the air will be thick and uncomfortable and calm and still conditions are expected. A few light raindrops may fall, overcast skies with low cloud, and a mix of sun and clouds. Changeable conditions.

washing.phrase: The current weather conditions are not suitable as it is raining.
